intro: Oldenlandia butensis, commonly known as the "Buteo vine," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
